intro: Daucus jordanicus, commonly known as Jordan's carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Daucus jordanicus is typically found in rocky or arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
